MainClaim.text: "Pico's philosophy was influenced by Anaxagoras's idea that all things exist in all things in their own mode"

s philosophy.text: "Anaxagoras holds the view that objects are temporary mixtures of ingredients

s principle.text: "Anaxagoras's principle is that all things exist in all things in their own mode"

s interpretation of Anaxagoras.text: "Pico's interpretation of Anaxagoras's philosophy is that all things exist in all things in their own mode"

s metaphysics.text: "Pico's metaphysics is that all things share a portion of God within them

s method of allegorical interpretation.text: "Pico's method of allegorical interpretation is indispensable for his syncretism and his attempt to reveal hidden truths in every text or level of reality"

s anthropocentrism.text: "Pico rejects the fixed position of man in the ontological hierarchy and argues that man has the chance to become everything"

s Intellect.text: "Anaxagoras's Intellect is the only thing in which the principle everything in everything does not apply"

s argumentation.text: "Pico's argumentation is ambivalent and lacks consistency"

s view on creation.text: "Pico's view on creation is that God creates Intellect

s view on the Intellect.text: "Pico's view on the Intellect is that it is a perfect and unique creation of God"

s view on the Demiurge.text: "Pico's view on the Demiurge is that it is the Demiurge-Intellect

s view on the Intellect and the One.text: "Pico's view on the Intellect and the One is that they are coextensive

s argumentation on the Intellect.text: "Pico's argumentation on the Intellect is that it is a perfect and unique creation of God"

s view on creation and emanation.text: "Pico's view on creation and emanation is that God creates Intellect

s view on the Intellect and the Demiurge.text: "Pico's view on the Intellect and the Demiurge is that they are distinct concepts in the Neoplatonic sense"

s view on the Demiurge-Intellect.text: "Pico's view on the Demiurge-Intellect is that it is a Demiurge-Intellect in the Neoplatonic sense"
